unnormalised: ## Chasing Viral: What's Popping in Social Media Now?
normalised: ## Chasing Viral: What's Popping in Social Media Now?

unnormalised: Hey guys, Priya here, and let’s talk VIRALITY. We all dream of that one post that explodes, right? Turns our little chai stall into a nationwide franchise overnight? Well, maybe not the chai stall *exactly*, but you get the gist.
normalised: Hey guys, Priya here, and let’s talk VIRALITY. We all dream of that one post that explodes, right? Turns our little chai stall into a nationwide franchise overnight? Well, maybe not the chai stall *exactly*, but you get the gist.

unnormalised: Right now, what’s trending is... unpredictable! But there are definitely some patterns we're seeing.
normalised: Right now, what’s trending is... unpredictable! But there are definitely some patterns we're seeing.

unnormalised: First, short-form video is STILL king. Think Reels, TikToks, even YouTube Shorts. If you’re not creating bite-sized, engaging content, you’re missing out. People have the attention span of a goldfish these days, especially after a long day battling Bangalore traffic. A funny skit about auto drivers haggling prices? Gold. A relatable rant about struggling to find parking at Brigade Road? Platinum!

unnormalised: Next up, authenticity sells. People are tired of overly polished, picture-perfect influencers. They want real, relatable content. Think less "Kareena Kapoor promoting luxury handbags" and more "Neha Sharma showing off her messy bun and talking about her favourite street food from Chandni Chowk." Show the real you, flaws and all. Even a video of a power cut in Gurgaon at 14:30 hrs and how you coped could resonate with thousands.

unnormalised: Also, user-generated content (UGC) is HUGE. Encourage your followers to create content using your product or service. Run a contest – "Best Diwali Outfit featuring [Your Brand Name]" – and watch the engagement skyrocket! Remember, people trust their friends and family more than they trust ads.

unnormalised: Lastly, riding the meme wave is always a good strategy. But be careful! Don’t force it. And please, for the love of all that is holy, don’t be offensive. The internet never forgets. Think about using existing Bollywood dialogues in a new context or poking fun at the crazy wedding rituals we all know and love. "Rasode mein kaun tha?" applied to a workplace scenario? Viral gold, I tell you!

unnormalised: Keep your eye on trending sounds and hashtags, experiment, and don't be afraid to be a little silly. Oh, and mark your calendars, the annual Ganesh Chaturthi festivities start around 19/09/2024, a goldmine of content creation opportunities! Just be respectful.

unnormalised: The landscape is constantly shifting. What worked last week might be old news tomorrow. Keep experimenting, keep learning, and most importantly, keep creating! Remember that time Sachin scored a double century on 24/02/2010? That was viral before "viral" was even a thing. The energy, the excitement... that's what you need to capture. Good luck, folks! Let me know what you think in the comments!
